title: Sit down coffee!
text: Mid-morning and Warren Street was fairly quiet so we were pleased to be able to get a free table outside. We very much enjoyed sitting out with our lovely coffees and an oh so tasty fitzroy bun. A definite find just down from busy Tottenham Court Road.

title: Lovely food and setting
text:
We had excellent cheese and onion toasties plus coffee at this place in the attractive Bocking gardens, just outside Braintree Town centre.

Everything was so fresh and tasty and made for a nice lunch in the park. Definitely recommended.

title: Great trip out
text:
As we inch out of lockdown, a nice outing was had to this National Trust owned site. Parking by the Mill Hall, it's a short walk up the stepped path - steep in parts but manageable - just be careful if it's muddy.

It was so quiet on Easter Sunday with just one or two people about. A nice view from the top and we enjoyed sitting on the bench by the pond having a picnic. Don't forget to check out the windmill nearby, from the outside at least, until lockdown lifts. Coffee from the nearby High Street rounded off a very pleasant day out.

title: Good takeaway coffee
text:
Good to see they were still open for takeaway, even on the first day of the tier 4 restrictions.

We very much enjoyed our coffee and hot chocolate. Plenty of space to wait for your drinks whilst keeping social distancing. Definitely recommended overall.

title: Excellent lunch
text:
We only had to wait a few minutes to get a table, even on a busy post-lockdown Saturday lunchtime. We very much enjoyed our poached eggs with toast, halloumi and patatas bravas plus a halloumi wrap. The eggs could have been a little warmer but it really didn't make much difference.

We also very much enjoyed a cappuccino and latte and it was no problem for us to request a mulled wine to take away.

Overall very highly recommended in the very pleasant Leigh town centre. We'll definitely try and come back.

title: Stunning church
text:
Simply walk along the main Christchurch High Street to the far end and you'll come to the Priory.

A terrific place to walk around with parts dating back as far as the Norman era. A shop and small cafe plus attractive gardens make for an excellent addition to any visit to Christcurch.

title: Great - went twice!
text:
We called in for some lovely coffees and, having failed to find anywhere that looked a better bet, returned for a late lunch.

We both found the Welsh rarebit so tasty as we sat in the window looking out on lovely Christchurch High Street. A toasted tea cake was also very nice.

All in all a highlight of our day in Christchurch.

title: Excellent dinner
text:
We actually saw this place mentioned in passing as a better option in a review of another place in Bournemouth. We sat upstairs and very much enjoyed the paintings and other decor throughout the restaurant. I should mention there's a lift available.

We very much enjoyed our halloumi burger and mac and cheese with a ciabatta. Also one of their cocktail variations was very pleasant.

This was our first visit to a Cosy Club and we'd definitely recommend it if you're in the Bournemouth area.

title: Great spot in Bournemouth
text:
Stayed here for 3 nights at this well located place almost opposite the Pavilion Theatre. The sea front and tourist information centre is only 5 minutes walk away and the town centre the same in the opposite direction. Only the station would probably need a bus or taxi to get to.

We stayed in a premier plus room which was great overall - spacious with a coffee machine, ironing board etc. For some reason these don't have a balcony or sea view which was a bit disappointing.

We had breakfast each morning at the hotel which was fine though it's best to book this in advance given the social distancing.

All in all a very good base for our break in Bournemouth.

title: Unheralded gem
text:
Excellent visit here to this house on the cliff top next to the Royal Bath hotel. As with many attractions these days it's best to book your timeslot/ticket on line beforehand.

There's an interesting 10 minute film on the first floor about the couple who owned both the house and hotel.

On the next floor up (a lift is available) is a lovely cafe which is well worth a stop prior to going into the main house. A guide to the rooms can be downloaded onto your phone and each is packed with art works and objects of interest.

Plenty of volunteers on hand to ask questions of as well. Also tremendous sea views from some of the rooms.

A nice souvenir shop rounded off an excellent visit.

title: Very good pizza
text:
Wanting somewhere nearby for supper on our first night in Bournemouth, we happened upon this very nice place. We were seated without having made a reservation and very much enjoyed the salad, margherita pizza and potato wedges that we had.

Everything was promptly brought up by the friendly staff. All in all, a very good start to our Bournemouth break.

title: Ok but could be better
text:
The hotel did a job for us overall as we were in the area for an overnight stay. Paid parking is available at the hotel and there was no problem finding a space.

We had an accessible room on the first floor of the annexe building. The shower had been left in far too high a position to be accessible but otherwise the room was fine and of a good size.

We booked for breakfast but were still told on arrival at the restaurant that there would be a 15-20 minute wait before they took our main order. Whilst we appreciate the problems caused by the pandemic, this seemed odd and why take reservations at all if that's the case?

The food was fine when it came.

Overall ok but we've had better experiences in other premier inns.

title: Ok but could be better
text:
We sat outside in Wanstead's pleasant High Street. Our frappe and latte took a little while to come. Latte was find but the frappe mocha tasted a bit powdery.

Not bad overall but other places in Wanstead are probably preferable for coffee.

title: Excellent
text:
We enjoyed a very nice snack lunch here sitting outside in the High Street.

We had a very tasty mozzarella toastie and nice cake plus lovely coffee.

A very good spot in Hornchurch's pleasant High Street.

title: Excellent coffee
text:
Popped in here mid-morning and had no problem waiting whilst the polite lady behind the counter caught up with her orders.

I took a seat inside as it was still fairly hot out and received an excellent latte within no more than 5-10 minutes.

A very nice cafe all round.

title: Attitude?
text:
I wandered in and ordered a coffee and was told in a rather surly way to take a seat. A pity as it has a nice conservatory part at the back and could be nice.

Coffee was good and served promptly in fairness.

title: Excellent lunch
text:
A rare opportunity to go out for lunch midweek and this proved an excellent choice. We had booked but, due to covid/recession/people working from home, had the place virtually to ourselves.

We very much enjoyed the small plates of bread, olives, patatas bravas and cheese balls. Great coffee also.

Service was very good and attentive. Hopefully they will get busier again as time goes on.

Definitely recommended if in the Kings Cross/Bloomsbury area.

title: Welcome back!
text:
My first visit since the refurbishment undertaken during lockdown. Nice decor and a slightly extended menu but still the same high quality food and service. We enjoyed all our dishes - excellent poached eggs, shepherd's pie and salad. Also lovely juice and coffees.

A warm welcome back to the High Street!

title: Coffee stop in Shoreditch
text:
We all very much enjoyed this place which is near the Old Street roundabout. It was quiet on a Sunday afternoon so we had no trouble finding a table outside.

We enjoyed both iced and hot coffees as well as a pastry and an excellent focaccia served warm.

A definite find in this part of London with friendly serving staff as well.

title: Coffee break
text:
We stopped off here to break our journey to Maldon. Only a small car park but the pub was quiet at the time so that wasn't a problem on a Saturday afternoon.

The pub was open for sit down customers, despite the sign outside giving a slightly different impression?

In any case, we enjoyed the decor and atmosphere of the pub very much as well as our coffee and soft drinks. A nice stop off from our journey.

title: Great lunch
text:
Lovely sandwiches, toasted bagel and drinks here on a hot Saturday afternoon. Friendly staff and good covid protocols with not just the tables but also the menus being regularly cleaned.

Would definitely recommend this place even against all the competition in Maldon's High Street.

title: Lovely goods and tea room
text:
A very enjoyable visit here in lovely Dedham, looking through the three floors of antiques and independent goods as well as enjoying coffee and ice cream in the centre's lovely tea room.

Definitely worth a stop if you're in Dedham.

title: Great coffees
text:
We enjoyed a very nice coffee stop at this heritage building just off Colchester's busy High Street.

They have put in plenty of Covid protocols so you can sit in the pretty courtyard or inside. We enjoyed lovely coffees and they were only too happy to box up a couple of scones for us to take with.

A nice way to end our break in Colchester.

title: Excellent takeout
text: We enjoyed excellent pizzas and dipper sides delivered to our hotel in Colchester. The website took a little bit of working out but the food was excellent.

title: Great coffee
text:
Stopped in here for coffee and cold drinks after a visit to the castle, the gate for which is almost opposite here.

Very nice drinks served by the friendly staff completed a very nice morning's visit.

title: Nice spot
text: A very pleasant park in central Colchester. As well as visiting the castle, we enjoyed taking time on the grass and just chilling out. A nice oasis in the centre of town.

title: Very good visit
text:
The museum had been massively modernised since I visited around 20 years ago and had just reopened following lockdown. Only very small areas were unavailable and they will take groups down to see the prison cells which are themselves definitely worth seeing.

The museum is fascinating and details the whole history of the town. The I-pads you are given free of charge took a bit of getting used to in terms of where to use them but we enjoyed being able to view a clip of a bbc history programme where they were examining Roman jewellery that is in fact on display just in front of you.

We booked in advance (by phone) although it looked like you could just walk up and enter when we were there.

A definite must do if you're in Colchester.

title: Good choice for a break
text:
Our first post lockdown hotel stay and this proved a very good choice. The hotel enjoys a good location in a quiet residential street very close to the entrance to Castle Park and is no more than a 10 minute walk from the High Street.

Our room was very clean - important in these difficult times of course. All printed material had been removed bar a useful sheet explaining the cleaning and hygiene processes at the hotel.

Breakfast was available at the Thyme restaurant but the buffet is no longer unfortunately. The good news though is that everything is cooked fresh to order now. On our second morning at least, they left the orders in the middle of the restaurant and beckoned you over to collect it yourself. Presumably the idea was to further reduce close contact between staff and customers and we soon got used to it.

There a fair size car park at the hotel and you pay on reception.

We were delighted the hotel was back open and very much enjoyed our stay.

title: Excellent meals
text:
We each enjoyed a good meal here sitting outside on a Sunday evening. Our steak, sea bass and borek options were each thoroughly enjoyed. Nice tiramisu for dessert too.

It seems you can also order pizzas from the building immediately next door so that widens the choice even further.

Definitely recommended if near Hackney's Victoria Park.

title: Fish and chips
text: We picked up cod goujons and chips from the apparently new takeaway kiosk. It was extremely tasty and nicely presented. Just had to wait a few minutes and I was called over by the friendly staff to collect it. A very good option on a busy summer Sunday in Leigh.

title: Great Coffee
text: We sat in for coffee which was excellent and I even returned later in the day for another cup. Also an excellent range of stuff in the food store. We'll have to return and have a meal there

title: Nice takeout drinks
text: Stopped here after searching Billericay High Street for somewhere open for a takeway hot drink on a Sunday. We were quickly served by the friendly staff and very much enjoyed our regular and iced lattes. Full marks also for being offered hand sanitser whilst I was waiting. As things hopefully return to normal, we'll have to come back and try the food.

title: Pre-Raphaelites
text:
I only had time to visit part of the museum located in the Council House. Good collection of pre-Raphaelite paintings and I also enjoyed learning about the Staffordshire Hoard of Anglo-Saxon artefacts.

A nice shop, cafe and tea room are on site. The lack of any admission charge was also a bonus.

title: Nice pizza
text:
Popped in here early on a Saturday lunchtime and easily found a table by the large windows.

I enjoyed a good value pizza and garlic bread which, as promised by the staff member, arrived within 10 minutes or so.

Don't be put off by the metro works immediately outside in Broad Street - the pub is open as normal and definitely worth seeking out.
place: The Soloman Cutler - Lloyds No1 Bar

title: Fresh pizza
text:
We enjoyed our freshly made pizza and pasta at this place at one end of busy Roman Road.

The service was a little slow at times and the hot chocolate seemed to be less thick and creamy than on a previous visit.

Still enjoyed the meal overall though.

title: Excellent
text:
We enjoyed an excellent late lunch here with so fresh toasted sandwiches and nice tea and coffee. We took some scones and cake home as well which were also very nice.

We looked round the informative museum just off the restaurant (no extra charge) and found the video about the history of the company and its factory very interesting. A well stocked shop showcasing not just Wilkin but products from other local producers rounded off a very nice day out.

We'll try and go again.

title: Excellent meal in Romford Market
text: We finally got round to trying the food here having been in for coffee many times. We enjoyed an excellent late lunch. Our pizza, curry and garlic bread were all so fresh and tasty and quickly served. More nice coffees rounded off an excellent meal. Highly recommended all round.

title: Enjoyed it
text:
Whilst the Rotunda is completely encased in scaffolding, the National Trust have sought to make the most of this by setting up a new exhibition that can run in semi darkness. Although it takes a little getting used to, we felt this did work overall.

We very much enjoyed the house and strolling in the Italianate gardens. There are also two very nice cafes and a good Trust shop on site. Also a second hand bookshop upstairs in the west wing.

We'll have to return and see the house when all the work has finished.

title: Really very nice!
text:
We very much enjoyed our visit here to the shop which is just on the corner as you enter Abbeygate Street.

We enjoyed a really excellent soup and cheese on toast plus lovely coffee and hot chocolate. Everything was brought up promptly by the friendly staff. No complaints at all.

title: Great birthday present
text:
A tour of the stadium was the perfect present for me. Such an interesting insight behind the scenes in areas including the changing rooms, tunnel, pitchside and media areas plus the hospitality parts.

Tour guides Russell and Elaine were very good and of course we got some great photos. The tour wristbands also get you a small discount at the pleasant m's cafe just along from the spurs shop/Tottenham experience.

A must for any fan of football or stadiums.

title: Excellent meal
text: We sought out this place (still only 15-20 mins walk from Syntagma Square) and were so glad we did. An excellent meal was had in lovely surroundings. Good service from the friendly, muliti-lingual staff. Also a small kosher grocery store on sight. All round a very good point of our lovely trip to Athens.

title: Very good - sporting history
text: Very good 5 euros here to see the site of the first modern Olympic Games in 1896 that also played a small part in 2004. The useful audio guide gave a very informative walk round. A small museum and shop made for a very good part of my Athens trip.

title: Very enjoyable
text: Popped in for a nice latte at this new (?) Place in Lower Marsh near Waterloo station. Nice coffee which you order at the till and they then bring up to the pleasant cafe area on the mezzanine floor. A good find in the area.

title: Excellent museum
text:
We had a very enjoyable visit to the Jewish Museum which is in what must be a converted private house a few minutes walk from Syntagma Square. Lots of very interesting exhibits spread over a number of floors (there is a lift available).

All signs are in English as well as Greek. Nice little gift shop by the ticket office as well and friendly staff made this a most enjoyable visit during our time in Athens. Definitely recommended.

title: Coffee stop
text: Had a stop at this attractive place in a square between Ermou Street and the Acroplois. Service seemed a little on the surly side but the coffees were nice and it was lovely to sit out in the square enjoying the atmosphere.

title: Centre of Athens
text: Very good meal here at this place just off central Syntagma Square. We enjoyed excellent pizza and pasta served by the friendly staff. Not that cheap but hardly excessive for the centre of town. A very enjoyable part of our Athens break.

title: Vey enjoyable meal
text: Very nice Sunday lunch here at this branch in busy South Woodford. No problem getting seated and we enjoyed the pizza, canelloni, pizza bread and tomatoes with mozarella. Also very nice coffees. Service was fine and we enjoyed it all really.

title: Good coffee
text: Part of the Russell Hotel, on the corner of Russell Square, I enjoyed a nice latte here om a Sunday morning. Sat at the window looking over the square. A nice stop after coimg out of the tube station nearby.

title: Very good overview
text:
This stunning building near the Akropoli metro station gives a great overview of how the sight functioned. Also terrific views of the Acropolis itself, particularly from the restaurant's outside terrace.

We missed the way in to the recent excavations in the basement unfortunately but were able to view some of these as you come up to the entrance.

We had a very nice coffee and cake in the cafe on the ground floor. All in all a great addition to our day at the Acropolis.

title: Knockout historical site but could be presented better
text:
Oh dear, wanted to give it more and it of course remains a must see in Athens but there are some really quite simple things that could be done to improve the experience. Firstly, the route up from the stop of the hop on hop off bus is not signed at all and isn't easy to find without having to double back on yourself. We also thought it ironic that the disabled elevator seems itself to be poorly signed and up a considerable climb (unless we missed something).

There are around a dozen separate parts to the site and it would seem tailor made for an audioguide. There isn't one though and you have to make do with the static signs (in english and greek). A good suggestion on here was to download an 'unofficial' one beforehand but there really should be their own one, as seen after all at the Panathenaic stadium for example. As it was, we were pleased we'd taken some guidebook pages with to assist in interpreting things.

Even still, it's a tremendous place, particularly the Parthenon and the Temple of Dionysus.

title: Changing of the guard
text: Staying very close by we were able to watch both the hourly changing of the guard and the full ceremony that takes place on a Sunday morning. Definitely worth a look if you're visiting this delightful city.

title: Nice lunch
text:
Nice lunch here for a group of five of us. A variety of high quality, tasty dishes were enjoyed including garlic and herb bread, eggs royale and fish finger sandwich. Nice drinks and coffee too.

Service could have been a little quicker at times but this wasn't a major issue.

title: A bit mixed but not all their fault
text:
It was a bit unfortunate really that when we took the bus the weather was poor and we had to sit downstairs. The bus could be redsigned to remove the branding from the window areas as it made it difficult to see through the windows on what was a very wet day. It also wasn't the company's fault that some demonstrations in the city meant some of the stops had to be bypassed and the cordoned off roads meant the traffic became very heavy.

Another suggestion would be for them to point out in some way the route from stop 7 to the entrance to the Acropolis as this really isn't very clear.

Despite the above we still enjoyed the tour and it made for an interesting start to our Athens break.

title: Excellent all round choice
text:
This turned out to be a very good choice for our Athens break. The hotel is maybe 100 metres from Syntagma Square and the Parliament building with many other attractions within walking distance. The metro stop is also just along the road and bus stops are opposite.

We had an extremely spacious room with a very large bed. Excellent bathroom too and a lovely balcony with views of the Parliament and national gardens. As another review has stated, it seems only the heating in the room works at this time of year rather than the air con though it wasn't a major problem.

We enjoyed the huge selction at breakfast each morning - one of the best we've seen anywhere and also had a nice casual dinner in the cafe-bar in the lobby. There's also a lovely roof terrace on the top floor with great views across to the Acropolis.

Like Athens generally, we were sorry when our stay came to an end. Very highly recommended all round.

title: Great collection
text:
We didn't originally plan to come here but were very glad we did. Huge collection of pottery and other ancient Greek finds plus many statues.

A better map/guide rather than the small photocopy you're given might help. Interesting shop in the basement and check out the pleasant coutyard by the cafe.

All in all recommended.

title: Excellent food
text:
A very nice anniversary meal here at this local place in the parade opposite Harold Wood station.

We ordered the sea bass which was so fresh and tasty as well as a number of sides. The feta borek was particularly good as were the dips and warm beds.

No compaints really. A coffee machine would be welcome though our apple and mint teas were also enjoyed.

title: Good portions of nice food
text:
Three of us came mid-afternoon and enjoyed a very nice late Sunday lunch. Very tasty food includind sea bass, onion rings, artisan breads, veggie burger and nut roast. We also enjoyed sharing the desert platter.

Downsides - not many really. Couldn't understand why they couldn't do a chai latte when it's shown on the menu and we probably hit the end of the Sunday lunch peak which meant it was very crowded in the car park. We managed to squeeze in somewhere but it wasn't easy. Don't forget to enter your reg no. on one of the consoles as you go into the main building.

All in all a very enjoyable meal and we'd look to go back.

title: No complaints
text: Attractive modern looking place on the London platform of Bath Spa railway station. Guess I may have been fortunate looking at the other reviews but I thought service was fine and enjoyed sitting with my latte waiting for the train. I'd use it again.

title: Lovely coffee shop
text: Located just at the start of Widcombe's attractive 'High Street' I enjoyed a nice coffee in the back room, up a few stairs. Managed to share a table and all in all a nice part of my day in Bath/Widcombe. Recommended.

title: Coffee good
text: Reliable standard in the main Paddington station food/shops area. I enjoyed a nice latte whilst waiting for a train. No complaints really.

title: Late lunch
text:
Three of us met here for a late Sunday lunch. It was busy but we were seated quickly. We very much enjoyed our food including a flat bread, chips and spicy rice bowl all of which was delivered pretty quickly considering the crowds.

A bit noisy of course but we enjoyed the new menu and will probably return.

title: Good coffee
text: There's a lot of competition in the Berwick Street area but I enjoyed a very nice latte here mid-morning. It was fairly quiet and I easily got a seat. Good quality coffee quickly served. Check out the very nice lounge area downstairs as well.

title: Good coffee
text: Popped into this new place in Edgware High Road after learning that Sophie's Kitchen has sadly closed. We had both hot and cold coffees which were very nice. The decor and 'living ceiling' aren't to everyone's taste but we felt worked overall. Seems like a good addition to the area's restaurants. Service was quick and attentive. Toilets were clean too.

title: Good meal overall
text:
We enjoyed as a large family group a birthday celebration meal in the rear part of the restaurant.

We had the pre-booked fixed menu but there were still choices for everyone. The accompanying hot bread and dips were excellent. Service was attentive throughout.

Just to add that it's not restaurant's fault but parking in the vicinity is very limited. There is the car park at the tube station but you will need to register by phone if you've not already done so.

title: Busy
text:
Four of us came in for coffee and pastries which were all very nice. The place seems extremely popular and was pretty much packed on a Sunday lunchtime.

Unfortunately the music being played was far too loud and didn't encourage us to stay any longer.

Finally, it's not the restaurant's fault but parking in the area is very limited. We parked in the station car park but you will need to register by phone if you've not done so previously.

title: Very good lunch
text:
We enjoyed a very nice lunch at this modern place in East Mersea that I had noticed on the Visit Mersea website. There is a nice outdoor terrace and field but, as it was a hot day, we opted to stay inside. No problem getting a table and our food was promptly brought up.

Everything was so freshly made and we very much enjoyed our goats cheese salad and spinach and halluomi open sandwich. The huge and piping hot triple cooked chips were a bonus as well.

We looked round the shop which has lots of locally made foods and arts & crafts and even went back to the restaurant for coffee and ice cream.

All in all, a real highlight of our day trip to Mersea Island.

title: Ok fish and chips
text:
Just off Oxford Street we got seated quickly on an early Saturday evening. There was nothing wrong with our fish and chips as such and the homemade tartare sauce was a bonus. It's just that we've had tastier fish and chips overall at some other places. I should say the food was served up to us very quickly.

Just to add that only one toliet for a place this size isn't really enough.

title: OK coffee shop
text: I had a nice latte here at this branch which is almost the first shop as you enter Spitalfields Market from the Bishopsgate side. Service was good and it was at least partly air conditioned on a hot day.

title: Excellent and fascinating
text:
I thoroughly enjoyed my trip here. A lengthy and fascinating guided tour follows a short film of Ramsgate during wartime and there's also a museum area to look round. It is a bit chilly though on the hottest day of the year, even this was welcome!

A nice cafe and small shop area round off an excellent attraction and a nice way to end our Ramsgate break.

title: Very good meal
text:
We had a most enjoyable meal at this fairly large place on the Ramsgate harbour front. We had a variety of starters and sides including excellent bread, nice chips and vegetable dishes.

Service was pretty good overall and it wasn't too busy early evening. A very nice part of our Ramsgsate break.

title: Fantastic views
text: There's no direct admission charge and it's £5 to park there (free for National Trust members). On a very hot day the breeze at the top was very refreshing and we enjoyed tremendous views not just over the Channel but of the ever busy Dover port as well. Very nice National Trust café and shop to enjoy at the start/end of your walk.

title: Nice walk in town
text: We enjoyed a nice walk - 10 minutes or so each way along the pier in Deal's attractive town centre. A sunny day made for a lovely experience. There are lots of benches if you fancy a rest midway. Looks like a nice restaurant at the far end.

title: Good base in Ramsgate
text:
We had a very enjoyable couple of nights here. Our room was spacious enough for our needs and the hotel is well located with the beach, restaurants, town centre and other attractions all within walking distance. Parking is available at the multi-storey over the road but be aware all but the ground floor is locked overnight (e-mails from the hotel and a sign in reception do explain this).

Breakfast was typical Travelodge fare and set us up fine for the day. This area of the hotel is also well air conditioned. Unfortunately the rooms aren't and, although they give you a fan, due to the very hot weather, we also had to leave the window open which proved to be a bit noisy. In fairness, the general weather at the time was exceptionally hot for southern England.

I'd definitely stay here again.

title: Excellent food and views
text:
We went with family members for a midweek dinner. The pub boasts superb views over the bay, even better from the upstairs dining room (not wheelchair accessible).

The food was of a very high standard with us really enjoying our baked camembert starter followed by grilled salmon and a vegetable tart with chips. Coffee was also of very good quality.

The only slight problem was the length of time it took for the drinks to arrive (not an issue with the food). This seemed more a problem with the bar downstairs rather than the waiting staff themselves.

Still a very nice evening overall though.

title: Good coffee
text: Popped in here for an afternoon coffee stop whilst in the Lambs Conduit Street area and this proved a good choice. I got a seat in the main part though I think there is more seating available downstairs. I enjoyed a very nice latte which was promptly brought over to me. Definitely recommended if you're in this area.

title: Good value lunch
text: I enjoyed a nice lunch here on a Saturday afternoon. I managed to get a small table near the bar and enjoyed a nice panini with hot chips and a garlic bread. Everything was served quite quickly so no complaints really.

title: Good drinks
text: We very much enjoyed our latte and cappuccino on a first visit here. Service was friendly. The only criticism would be they couldn't do an iced coffee, even though it was a warm day. Nice vibe though and we enjoyed sitting in there for a while.

title: Good coffee
text: We stopped in here for coffee and tea before flying to the Champions League final. Service was enthusiastic from the gentleman behind the till wearing a sunhat (!) and there was nothing wrong with our drinks. We managed to find a couple of seats even though the airport was busy so that was good.

title: Traditional tea shop
text:
Lovely tea shop next to the optician in BoC High Street. We had a very nice savoury cream tea with lovely cheese to spread and relish. Also a very nice warm scone and toasted crumpet. Service was very friendly as we sat out in the garden area. We also liked all the bric a brac to look at on the way in and out.

A definite find in pretty Burnham on Crouch.
place: Harbour Antiques and Georgian Tea Garden

title: Good coffee
text:
Easily spotted in the middle of Burnham on Crouch High Street, we enjoyed very nice cappuccinos and lattes on a bank holiday visit. The place is quite small but we managed to get a table.

Service was prompt and friendly. They don't take credit cards but that wasn't an issue. Highly recommended if visiting this Essex coastal town.
